How to play active:
1. Buy at least 2 autoclickers
2. Place 1 on hero rest on monster
3. Click on "buy all ancients"
4. Select active in your calculator of choice and level accordingly
5. Use skills after losing instakill (if not infinite yet use LS+GC, then energize reload, then repeat)

Iris was removed in order to compensate for HS rewards growing exponentially. If Iris was to be added back into the game, the HS rewards from every primal would have to be nerfed in the same way they were buffed in the 1.0 patch. So we would be back to shorter runs for less HS. If Iris was to be added with the current rewards, optimal play would be extremely short runs, which would require you to pay 24/7 attention to the game. Kumawakamaru's bonus was long term increased and timelapse progresses through zones in order to increase the progress a bit with the removal of Iris.

Mercenaries are a source of resources including: Hero Souls, Rubies, More Mercs, Skills, and Relics (Presents, but only during Christmas event.) They level up once per 24 hours of quests, and has a 20% chance to die per 24 hours of quests, they are able to be revived with rubies/extra lives.
In general, the best quest is almost always rubies, excluding recruit and present quests.
More info, including math on what quests are best and when to revive mercs: <https://www.reddit.com/r/ClickerHeroes/comments/ahupf4/ch1_single_mercenary_strategies_for_quests_revive/>
Baby don't hurt me, don't hurt me, no more.
Ancient Souls or AS should be spent according to <https://driej.github.io/Clicker-Heroes-Outsiders/>, also found in <#207675653091229697>
Transcend after 3-4 ascensions that gain AS until 24.x% TP. After this you go until Borb runs out and push a bit further than 2mpz every trans following this rule

TP or Transcendence Power is a function in the game that provides more HS from primal bosses. The TP cap is 25%, increasing to this point through AS and therefore transcendence. Your main goal is the efficiently earn your TP and transcend optimally from it.
The outsiders are essentially super-ancients, which have varied abilities to enhance game play throughout your next transcendence; They are hired and leveled with Ancient Souls.

Your ancients are a branch of new 'hero' type deities that can be leveled and bought with Hero Souls. Each one does a different function and overall they can affect your ascensions very much. Some Ancients are affected by Outsiders(eg. Atman) and others add direct damage etc.
Rubies can be collected from Clickables as well as Mercs. They are best spent first on 2ACs, then 2x damage, 3 more ACs, and after this you save up for Time Lapses and Quick Ascensions.

Time Lapses are a feature in the game that allows you to warp through zones by paying rubies. They are: 
8 hr: 36K zones max, 10 rubies
24 hr: 108K zones max, 20 rubies
48hr: 216K zones max, 30 rubies
168hr: 756K zones max, 50 rubies

Quick Ascensions are a form of skipping normal ascension, in the sense that for 50 rubies you earn HS for that ascension and move forward from your current zone rather than climbing up there. From Zone 285K to 1M these are the most efficient, as before then you should still use only TLs and after zone 1 million they are capped and will stop at around 1e19384 HS. QA gives the average amount you should have for that ascension based on PBC.

Once you reach zone 300 for the first time Transcend and use Driej's outsider calc to spend your AS. Driej's outsider calc and the 3 ancient calcs can all be found in the useful info channel. 

Then Ascend at zone 130 the first time after every Transcension (110 if it's slow). Get Siya, Lib, Mammon, Mimzee, Kuma and Atman (Bhaal, Jugg, Pluto, Frags instead of Siya and Lib if active) and use one of the ancient calculators to level them. Ascend whenever you cannot beat a boss and then continue to buy all ancients and level them with one of the ancient calculators. Driej's outsider calc also tells you when to transcend again at the top in the yellow box, and gives you an estimate of when that happens (assuming you're click build).

You should set your HS ancient calculator to hybrid. 
Then start the ascension with the autoclicker on your strongest hero and go as far as idle can reach. 
Once idle starts slowing down switch the autoclicker to the monster and then level the hero manually. 
Do this until you stop instakilling things and then use lucky strikes+golden clicks+energize+reload. This combo gives you both skills back, allowing you to repeat it next time you stop instakilling, extending your ascension a lot.
Once you get a 2nd autoclicker go full active, there are 0 benefits to progressing with hybrid over active unless you're utilizing offline progress or timelapses (starting at zone 50k+)

Siyalatas is still worth leveling.

You normally do 100% damage. Siyalatas gives you a +100% multiplier level 4, so you get double your damage. Each rank of Siya gives 25%, each hero soul gives a 10% bonus. They stack with your total DPS multiplicatively. So if you have 100 damage, 10 hero souls, and a level 4 (100%) Siya: `100 damage * 2 (+100% HS damage) * 2 (+100% Siya damage) = 400` damage If you were to level up Siya at that point for 5 HS: `100 damage * 1.5 (+50% HS damage) * 2.25 (+125% Siya damage) = 337.5 damage`

In another scenario, you have 100 HS and a level 4 Siyalatas. You normally do 100 damage without the bonuses, so with the 100 HS you do 100 + 1000% = 1100

The level 4 Siyalatas the increases that damage to 1100 + 100% = 2200 damage. Upgrading Siyalatas in this case would cost you 5 Hero Souls, which would leave your bank at 95 HS left. This means your new damage would be:

100 damage + 950 % + 125 % = 2362,5 damage.

So as you can see, upgrading Siy isn't always going to increase your total DPS. However, since both HS and Siy are multipliers on top of your normal damage, as your HS increases, there will always be a point where leveling Siy will give you a DPS boost.

Clicker Heroes is a single-player game with no defined 'win' condition.  You are free to play it however you want to.  Nobody cares if you cheat, we only care if you lie about cheating (especially when reporting bugs) because it wastes our time.  If you ask us for advice, we are going to assume you want to make fast progress to high zones and are willing to use everything in the game to get there, and we'll give you the best advice we know. We can give advice for playing under special circumstances, such as on a computer you can only use for part of the day, if you tell us clearly what those circumstances are.  Please do not assume you know more than us about the game.  If you choose to ignore our advice, please do not complain about slow progress.

To revert to a backup file you need to go to:
C:\Users\USERNAMEHERE\AppData\Roaming\ClickerHeroes2\Local Store

for Mac go to:
Library/Application Support/ClickerHeroes2/Local Store

Delete the file user.data and then open the folder user_backup and copy the latest file. Then go back to the previous folder and paste that file and rename it to user.data.

After that you will need to go to:
C:\Users\USERNAMEHERE\AppData\Roaming\ClickerHeroes2\Local Store\saves\Helpful Adventurer

for Mac go to:
Library/Application Support/ClickerHeroes2/Local Store/saves/Helpful Adventurer

Delete the file character.save and then open the folder character_backup and copy the latest file. Then go back to the previous folder and paste that file and rename it to character.save. If you are still receiving the error you may need to repeat these steps, but try an older backup.
